intro: Borreria multibracteata, commonly known as the Mexican broom, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, branched growth habit and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Borreria multibracteata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
